author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi … pe … “pañcahi, āvuso, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsājīvo sabrahmacārīnaṃ.
segments.en: There Venerable Sāriputta addressed the mendicants: … “A mendicant with five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.

segments.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu attanā ca sīlasampanno hoti, sīlasampadākathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
segments.en: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.

segments.pli: attanā ca samādhisampanno hoti, samādhisampadākathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
attanā ca paññāsampanno hoti, paññāsampadākathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
attanā ca vimuttisampanno hoti, vimuttisampadākathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
attanā ca vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadākathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti.
segments.en: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, āvuso, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsājīvo sabrahmacārīnan”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.”
